plain_text: Entire villages on either side of Athens have been razed by fast-moving wildfires, which have killed at least 74 people in the last 2 days. Emergency crews found the bodies of 26 people, including children, huddled together on a cliff. They were trying to escape the flames.

plain_text: With deadly wildfires scorching Greece and California, drought throwing Capetown, South Africa, into a water crisis, and heat searing Japan, just days after flooding killed 150, the signs of an over-stressed planet seem everywhere.  (2/5)

plain_text: Officials in Greece say at least 74 people have died from surprisingly fast-moving wildfires that struck near Athens.

plain_text: At least 74 people were killed due to wildfires in Greece. Thousands have fled, some aboard rickety boats and makeshift rafts.
